description: Default light color for WCAG 2.0.
Calculate the relative luminance for a color.

context.name: k-color-luminance

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: The color to calculate the relative luminance for.

return.description: The relative luminance for the color.

usedBy.description: Calculates contrast ratio between two colors

context.name: k-color-contrast-ratio

usedBy.description: Calculates contrast ratio between two colors

context.name: k-color-contrast-ratio

usedBy.description: Checks if a color is dark

context.name: k-is-dark
context.code: @return if( k-color-luminance( $color ) < .5, true, false );

usedBy.description: Checks if a color is light

context.name: k-is-light
context.code: @return if( k-color-luminance( $color ) < .5, false, true );

description: Calculates contrast ratio between two colors

context.name: k-color-contrast-ratio

return.description: The contrast ratio between the two colors

usedBy.description:
Calculates the contrast ratio between a background color and a foreground color.
If the contrast ratio is not high enough, it will return the color with the highest contrast ratio.

context.name: k-contrast-color

description: Checks if a color is dark

context.name: k-is-dark
context.code: @return if( k-color-luminance( $color ) < .5, true, false );

return.description: True if the color is dark, false otherwise

description: Checks if a color is light

context.name: k-is-light
context.code: @return if( k-color-luminance( $color ) < .5, false, true );

return.description: True if the color is light, false otherwise

description:
Calculates the contrast ratio between a background color and a foreground color.
If the contrast ratio is not high enough, it will return the color with the highest contrast ratio.

context.name: k-contrast-color

parameter.name: dark
parameter.description: The dark color to use as a fallback

parameter.name: light
parameter.description: The light color to use as a fallback

parameter.name: min-ratio
parameter.description: The minimum contrast ratio to reach

return.description: The color with the highest contrast ratio

usedBy.description: Generates all color variations of a given main color

context.name: k-generate-color-variations

description:
The color white.
Note: you cannot change this value.

The color black.
Note: you cannot change this value.

The color transparent.
Note: you cannot change this value.

A gradient that goes from transparent to black.
Note: you cannot change this value.

A gradient that goes from transparent to white.
Note: you cannot change this value.

A gradient that goes from black to transparent.
Note: you cannot change this value.

A gradient that goes from white to transparent.
Note: you cannot change this value.

A gradient that cycles through the colors of the rainbow.
Note: you cannot change this value.
Generates all color variations of a given main color

context.name: k-generate-color-variations

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the main color

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: The color value to be assigned to the main color

parameter.name: theme
parameter.description: The theme the colors will be generated for

return.description: A map with the generated keys and values

description:
Takes a color name from the $kendo-colors map as a parameter
and returns a CSS variable with the actual color as a fallback

context.name: k-color

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: The name of a color/key in the $kendo-colors map

return.description: CSS variable with the actual color as a fallback

throw: Color Variable \`#{$key}\` does not exists in the color collection.

description: The global default Colors map.

description: Converts a color with alpha to solid color mixed with a background color

context.name: k-rgba-to-mix
context.code:
$percent: color.alpha( $color ) * 100%;

    @return k-color-mix( rgba( $color, 1 ), $bg, $percent );

description: The global default Elevation map.
The global map of motion easing tokens.
The global map of motion duration tokens.
The global map of motion transition tokens.
The Gray Palette provides colors to the Base, Secondary, Light, Dark, and Inverse variable groups.
The Coral Palette provides colors to the Primary and Series A variable groups.
The Sky Blue Palette provides colors to the Tertiary variable group.
The Green Palette provides colors to the Success variable group.
The Blue Palette provides colors to the Info variable group.
The Yellow Palette provides colors to the Warning variable group.
The Red Palette provides colors to the Error variable group.
The Lemon Yellow Palette provides colors to the Series B variable group.
The Spring Green Palette provides colors to the Series C variable group.
The Royal Blue Palette provides colors to the Series D variable group.
The Lavender Purple Palette provides colors to the Series E variable group.
The Flamingo Pink Palette provides colors to the Series F variable group.

The extra small border radius used across the Components.

The large border radius used across the Components.

The third largest border radius used across the Components.
The second largest border radius used across the Components.
The largest border radius used across the Components.
The global radii Map.
The global default Spacing map.

description:
Restricts `$number` to the range between `$min` and `$max`. If `$number` is
less than `$min`, `$min` is returned. If `$number` is greater than `$max`,
`$max` is returned. Otherwise, `$number` is returned.

context.name: k-math-clamp
context.code: @return math.max($min, math.min($max, $number));

description: Returns the result of raising `$x` to the power of `$n`.

context.name: k-math-pow

return.description: The result of raising `$x` to the power of `$n`.

usedBy.description:
Returns the result of rounding `$number` to the nearest integer
using the specified `$precision`.

context.name: k-math-round

description:
Returns the result of rounding `$number` to the nearest integer
using the specified `$precision`.

context.name: k-math-round

parameter.name: precision
parameter.description: The number of decimal places to round to.

usedBy.description: Checks whether `$value` is a <integer> CSS data type.

context.name: k-meta-is-integer
context.code: @return k-meta-is-number($value) and k-math-round($value) == $value;

description: Remove the unit from a number.

context.name: k-math-strip-unit

parameter.name: number
parameter.description: The number to remove the unit from.

description: Checks whether `$value` is a <number> CSS data type.

context.name: k-meta-is-number
context.code: @return meta.type-of($value) == "number";

usedBy.description: Checks whether `$value` is a <integer> CSS data type.

context.name: k-meta-is-integer
context.code: @return k-meta-is-number($value) and k-math-round($value) == $value;

usedBy.description: Checks whether `$value` is a <time> CSS data type.

context.name: k-meta-is-time
context.code: @return k-meta-is-number($value) and string.index("ms" "s", math.unit($value)) != null;

usedBy.description: Checks whether `$value` is a <angle> CSS data type.

context.name: k-meta-is-angle
context.code: @return k-meta-is-number($value) and string.index("deg" "rad" "grad" "turn", math.unit($value)) != null;

usedBy.description: Checks whether `$value` is a <frequency> CSS data type.

context.name: k-meta-is-frequency
context.code: @return k-meta-is-number($value) and string.index("Hz" "kHz", math.unit($value)) != null;

usedBy.description: Checks whether `$value` is a relative <length> CSS data type.

context.name: k-meta-is-relative-length
context.code: @return k-meta-is-number($value) and string.index("em" "ex" "ch" "rem" "vw" "vh" "vmin" "vmax", math.unit($value)) != null;

usedBy.description: Checks whether `$value` is an absolute <length> CSS data type.

context.name: k-meta-is-absolute-length
context.code: @return k-meta-is-number($value) and string.index("cm" "mm" "in" "px" "pt" "pc", math.unit($value)) != null;

usedBy.description: Checks whether `$value` is a <percentage> CSS data type.

context.name: k-meta-is-percentage
context.code: @return k-meta-is-number($value) and math.unit($value) == "%";

usedBy.description: Checks whether `$value` is a <resolution> CSS data type.

context.name: k-meta-is-resolution
context.code: @return k-meta-is-number($value) and string.index("dpi" "dpcm" "dppx", math.unit($value)) != null;

context.code: @return k-meta-is-number($value) and string.index("ms" "s", math.unit($value)) != null;

usedBy.description: Checks whether `$value` is a valid duration period.

description: Checks whether `$value` is a <frequency> CSS data type.

context.name: k-meta-is-frequency
context.code: @return k-meta-is-number($value) and string.index("Hz" "kHz", math.unit($value)) != null;

description: Checks whether `$value` is a relative <length> CSS data type.

context.name: k-meta-is-relative-length
context.code: @return k-meta-is-number($value) and string.index("em" "ex" "ch" "rem" "vw" "vh" "vmin" "vmax", math.unit($value)) != null;

usedBy.description: Checks whether `$value` is a <length> CSS data type.

context.name: k-meta-is-length
context.code: @return k-meta-is-relative-length($value) or k-meta-is-absolute-length($value);

description: Checks whether `$value` is an absolute <length> CSS data type.

context.name: k-meta-is-absolute-length
context.code: @return k-meta-is-number($value) and string.index("cm" "mm" "in" "px" "pt" "pc", math.unit($value)) != null;

usedBy.description: Checks whether `$value` is a <length> CSS data type.

context.name: k-meta-is-length
context.code: @return k-meta-is-relative-length($value) or k-meta-is-absolute-length($value);

description: Checks whether `$value` is a <percentage> CSS data type.

context.name: k-meta-is-percentage
context.code: @return k-meta-is-number($value) and math.unit($value) == "%";

usedBy.description: Checks whether `$value` is a <position> CSS data type.

context.name: k-meta-is-position
context.code: @return k-meta-is-length($value) or k-meta-is-percentage($value) or string.index("top" "right" "bottom" "left" "center", $value) != null;

context.name: k-meta-is-length
